briefdescription.para: Maps active GameObject EntityIds to their index in activeGameObjects_.

detaileddescription.para: Enables O(1) lookup for release operations.

briefdescription.para: Tracks version numbers for active EntityHandles.

detaileddescription.para: Used to validate that a release operation targets the correct entity version.

briefdescription.para: List of EntityHandles for currently active (in-use) GameObjects.
List of EntityHandles for currently inactive (available) GameObjects.
The maximum number of objects this pool manages.
Minimum EntityId in the pool (used for sparse array offset).
Maximum EntityId in the pool (used for sparse array sizing).
Offset for sparse array indexing (equals minEntityId_ after lock).
Unique identifier for this pool instance.
True if the pool is locked and ready for acquire/release operations.
Constructs a GameObjectPool with the specified capacity.

detaileddescription.para: Pre-allocates internal storage for the given pool size. The pool starts empty; use `addInactive()` or a factory to populate it.

parameterdescription.para: The maximum number of GameObjects this pool can manage.

briefdescription.para: Returns the unique identifier of this pool.

simplesect.para: The Guid assigned to this pool instance.

briefdescription.para: Returns the maximum capacity of this pool.

simplesect.para: The pool size specified at construction.

briefdescription.para: Acquires an inactive GameObject from the pool.

detaileddescription.para: Removes a EntityHandle from the inactive list and adds it to the active tracking structures. The caller is responsible for activating the actual GameObject in the GameWorld.

parameterdescription.para: Receives the EntityHandle of the acquired object on success.

simplesect.para: True if an object was acquired, false if the pool is exhausted.

briefdescription.para: Checks if the pool is locked.

simplesect.para: True if the pool is locked and ready for acquire/release operations.

briefdescription.para: Locks the pool for acquire/release operations.

detaileddescription.para: After locking, no more EntityHandles can be added via `addInactive()`. The sparse arrays are sized based on the min/max EntityIds added.

briefdescription.para: Adds a EntityHandle to the inactive list without acquiring it.

detaileddescription.para: Used during pool initialization to register pre-created GameObjects. Fails if the pool is already at capacity.

parameterdescription.para: The EntityHandle of the GameObject to add.

simplesect.para: True if added successfully, false if pool is full.

briefdescription.para: Releases a GameObject back to the pool by its EntityHandle.

detaileddescription.para: Validates the EntityHandle against both the GameWorld and the active tracking list. Uses swap-and-pop for O(1) removal from the active list. The object is marked inactive and added to the inactive list for future acquisition.

parameterdescription.para: The unique identifier of the GameObject to release.

simplesect.para: True if the object was successfully released, false if the EntityHandle was not found in the GameWorld or not tracked as active.

briefdescription.para: Releases and permanently removes a GameObject from the pool.

detaileddescription.para: Unlike `release()`, this method does not add the EntityHandle back to the inactive list. Use this when a pooled object is being destroyed rather than recycled.

parameterdescription.para: The unique identifier of the GameObject to remove.

simplesect.para: True if removed successfully, false if EntityHandle was not active.

briefdescription.para: Returns the number of active game objects.

simplesect.para: The number of active game objects.

briefdescription.para: Returns the number of inactive game objects.

simplesect.para: The number of inactive game objects.

briefdescription.para: Returns a span of all inactive EntityHandles.
Returns a span of all active EntityHandles.
Object pool for efficient GameObject lifecycle management.

detaileddescription.para: GameObjectPool manages a fixed-size collection of GameObject identifiers, tracking which objects are currently active (in-use) and which are inactive (available). This pattern eliminates runtime allocation overhead for frequently spawned entities like projectiles, particles, or enemies.

The pool uses O(1) operations for both acquire and release:
**acquire**: Pops from the inactive list and adds to active tracking
**release**: Swap-and-pop removal from active list, push to inactive
GameObjects themselves are owned by GameWorld; this pool only tracks their EntityHandles.

xrefdescription.para: Prevent duplicate EntityHandles from being added to the pool.
